modules.description: Handles incoming HTTP connections on a Unix domain socket. It creates a connection handler that processes requests using provided request and error handlers, and runs the HTTP server loop on a given file descriptor. Useful for implementing Unix socket-based HTTP servers with custom routing and error responses.

This module provides a function to send HTTP requests over a Unix file descriptor, handling errors and responses through provided callbacks. It works with HTTP request and response types, along with Unix file descriptors for network communication. A concrete use case is implementing custom HTTP clients that interact with web servers using raw sockets.

This module enables building HTTP clients and servers that communicate over Unix file descriptors, handling both incoming and outgoing HTTP traffic with custom logic. It provides core data types like HTTP requests and responses, along with operations to accept connections, send requests, and process errors using callbacks. You can implement a Unix socket-based HTTP server that routes requests with custom handlers or create a low-level HTTP client that sends requests over raw sockets and processes responses asynchronously.
